The Password is not stored on the device and is requested again for each connection to the bank. Load accounts No bank added yet. Import maximum available transaction history

Update transactions End-to-end reference Customer Reference Mandate reference Creditor identifier Debtor identifier Balance Load Import into Select the bank accounts that you want to manage with My Expenses. You can either import them into a new account or select any existing account (with exception of cash accounts) as target. In the latter case, you will need to adjust the account\'s opening balance manually. Please be aware, that not all banks provide access to all accounts by the procedure that My Expenses understands (For example, for Sparkassen, credit cards are not supported). From the main screen, when an account linked to your bank is displayed, select Load transactions from the menu in order to update. My Expenses allows you to load account information (transaction history) from your bank in Germany, if it supports FinTS. It does not support payment initiation. From the Settings screen, additional bank connections can be configured. Please select one of the available TAN media: Save selection Please confirm the request on your smartphone. Please select the desired PIN/TAN mechanism: Prior to version 3.8.8, the PIN you provided for communicating with the FinTS server, was also used as password for encrypting locally stored sensitive information (passport), which made it impossible to change the PIN. Since version 3.8.8, a randomly generated password, that is written to a file encrypted with a key stored in the Android KeyStore, is used instead. By providing the PIN that you used when you setup this FinTS connection, it will be saved in the same secure way, and thus can be used for decrypting the passport, independent of the PIN that can now be updated. Password securely stored. Migrate Reset stored TAN mechanism
